announcements.title: The Cathedral will resume regular Mass Schedule as of February 16th, 2021. Mass times below.
announcements.descriptive:
Due to Covid-19, we will be resuming our previous Mass Schedule at 30% capacity.
Our schedule will continue to be updated.

Parishioners are asked to review
[Worship Safe in Pictures and Points](http://peterboroughdiocese.org/en/resourcesGe…).

The televised Sunday Mass will continue on YouTube.
Check [Special events](#schedule2) below for information and links.

announcements.title: Join our mailing list
announcements.descriptive:
Be the first to know!
Stay in the loop with everything going on at The Cathedral.

Sign up to receive regular updates, announcements, links to bulletins, and more,
delivered straight to your inbox!

Let's stay connected.

[Sign up...](https://mailchi.mp/ac8e8cadb5e8/dont-miss-out)

announcements.title: Day of Reconciliation
announcements.subtitle: March 27, 2021
announcements.descriptive: We will be offering our Lenten Day of Reconciliation from 9:30am - 5:00pm with multiple priests available. Please follow signs, wear a mask, sign in Contact Tracing books and maintain social distancing.

announcements.title: Daily Lenten Reflection
announcements.subtitle: March 26, 2021
announcements.descriptive:
"If I am not doing the works of the Father, then do not believe me. But if I do them, even though you do not believe me, believe the works...." says Christ our Lord.

During this season of Lent, we hear the amazing miracles, wonders, sayings and teachings of Christ. The purpose of His coming is to give us all life, a life that will never end. He wants us all to be with Him forever.

When we put our trust in Christ and do everything according to His will, we will be given life. Yes, we will have prosperity on earth and everlasting life after.

Let us keep the commandments of Christ namely loving God with all our heart, mind, body and soul; and loving our neighbour as ourselves. God bless. - Fr. Peter Selvaraj
